item.title: How to extract an item from an array in a JSON object in MySQL
item.description: To extract an item from an array in MySQL you need to use the -> operator and the [item_number] JSON Path Syntax.

item.title: How to remove an item from a JSON array in PostgreSQL®?
item.description: PostgreSQL® offers two types of data types to handle JSON data, JSON and JSONB, you can use the - operator to remove an item from an array.

item.title: How to create a JSON object from array of key/value pairs in PostgreSQL®?
item.description: PostgreSQL® offers two types of data types to handle JSON data, JSON and JSONB, you can use the function json_object (jsonb_object for JSONB) to create a JSON object from an array of key/value pairs.

item.title: How to create a JSON object from keys and values arrays in PostgreSQL®?
item.description: PostgreSQL® offers two types of data types to handle JSON data, JSON and JSONB, you can use the function json_object (jsonb_object for JSONB) to create a JSON object from two arrays of keys and values.

item.title: How to convert an array to a JSON array in PostgreSQL
item.description: PostgreSQL® offers two types of data types to handle JSON data, JSON and JSONB, you can use the function array_to_json (array_to_jsonb for JSONB) to create a JSON array from an existing array.

item.title: How to build a JSON array from a list of elements in PostgreSQL®
item.description: PostgreSQL® offers two types of data types to handle JSON data, JSON and JSONB, you can use the function json_build_array (jsonb_build_array for JSONB) to create a JSON array from a list of elements.
